lines.content: * The Duke class is the main class of the Duke application.
* It initializes the UI, storage, and task list, and handles the main program loop.
* Initializes the UI, storage, and task list, and loads data from storage.
* The main method that starts the Duke application.
* Continues reading user input and handling it until the user decides to exit.
* Custom exception class for Duke application.
* This class extends the standard Exception class to provide
* specific error handling for the Duke application.
* Constructs a new DukeException with the specified error message.
* @param e the detail message (which is saved for later retrieval by the getMessage() method)
* Returns the detail message string of this exception.
* @return the detail message string of this DukeException instance
* Parser class for handling user input in the Duke application.
* This class is responsible for processing user commands and interacting with the TaskList.
* Constructs a new Parser with the specified Scanner.
* @param scan the Scanner object to be used for reading user input
* Handles user input in a loop until the user decides to exit.
* This method processes various commands such as list, mark, unmark, delete, and task creation.
* @return false if the user wants to exit, true otherwise
* Preprocesses the input string by splitting it into command and arguments.
* This method also trims whitespace and converts the command to lowercase.
* @param input the raw input string from the user
* @return an array of two strings, where the first element is the command (lowercase) and the second is the arguments
* The Storage class handles reading from and writing to the file system.
* It follows the Singleton pattern to ensure only one instance exists.
* Gets the singleton instance of the Storage class.
* Reads data from the file system and loads it into the TaskList.
* Creates necessary directories and files if they don't exist.
* Writes the current TaskList data to the file system.
* Static method to save data to the file system using the singleton instance.
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* @param description The description of the task
* @param by The deadline of the task
* Represents an event task with a start and end time.
* @param description The description of the event
* @param from The start time of the event
* @param to The end time of the event
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
return "[E]" + super.toString() + " (from: " + this.from.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy HH:mm")) + " to: " + this.to.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy HH:mm")) + ")";
* @param description The description of the task
* @param taskType The type of the task
* Gets the status icon of the task.
* @return "X" if the task is done, " " otherwise
* Marks the task as done and prints a message.
if (this.isDone) System.out.println("Task already marked as done:\n" + this);
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + this);
* Marks the task as done without printing a message.
* Marks the task as not done and prints a message.
if (!this.isDone) System.out.println("Task already marked as not done:\n" + this);
System.out.println("Ok, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + this);
* Returns a string representation of the task for saving.
* @return A string representation of the task
* The TaskList class manages a list of tasks.
* It follows the Singleton pattern to ensure only one instance exists.
* Gets the singleton instance of the TaskList class.
* Loads a task from a string representation and adds it to the task list.
* @param data String representation of the task
new Event(line[2], LocalDateTime.parse(line[3].trim(), dtf), LocalDateTime.parse(line[4].trim(), dtf));
default -> throw new DukeException("Invalid Task type provided.");
* Prints all tasks in the list.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Filters and prints all tasks containing the input.
System.out.println("No matching tasks found in your list.");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Returns a copy of the task list.
* Creates a new task and adds it to the list.
* @param type Type of the task (todo, deadline, or event)
* @throws DukeException If the input is invalid
public void createTask(String type, String input) throws DukeException {
if (input.isEmpty()) throw new DukeException("Empty Task description provided.");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
if (!input.contains("/by") || input.indexOf("/by") == input.length() - 3) throw new DukeException("Invalid deadline description provided.");
) throw new DukeException("Invalid event description provided.");
System.out.printf("Now you have %d tasks in the list.\n", this.taskStore.size());
* Deletes a task from the list.
* @param input Index of the task to delete
* @throws DukeException If the index is invalid or the list is empty
public void deleteTask(String input) throws DukeException {
if (this.taskStore.isEmpty()) throw new DukeException("Task list is already empty.");
if (input.isEmpty()) throw new DukeException("No Task index provided.");
if (reg.isEmpty()) throw new DukeException("No index provided.");
if (id > this.taskStore.size() || id < 1) throw new DukeException("Invalid index provided.");
System.out.printf("Now you have %d tasks in the list.\n", this.taskStore.size());
* @param input Index of the task to mark as done
* @throws DukeException If the index is invalid or the list is empty
public void mark(String input) throws DukeException {
if (this.taskStore.isEmpty()) throw new DukeException("List is empty, no tasks to mark.");
if (input == null) throw new DukeException("No input provided.");
if (reg.isEmpty()) throw new DukeException("No index provided.");
if (id > this.taskStore.size() || id < 1) throw new DukeException("Invalid index provided.");
* Marks a task as not done.
* @param input Index of the task to mark as not done
* @throws DukeException If the index is invalid or the list is empty
public void unmark(String input) throws DukeException {
if (this.taskStore.isEmpty()) throw new DukeException("List is empty, no tasks to unmark.");
if (input == null) throw new DukeException("No input provided.");
if (reg.isEmpty()) throw new DukeException("No index provided.");
if (id > this.taskStore.size() || id < 1) throw new DukeException("Invalid index provided.");

private final static String greeting = "Hello from\n" + logo + "\nWhat can I do for you?";
private final static String goodbye = "Bye! Hope to see you again soon!";

"Now you have 1 tasks in the list.\n";
expected = "Got it. I've added this task:\n" +

expected = "Got it. I've added this task:\n" +
